passages.text: Market Insights | Markets | Equities
LVMH: Buy (RT: €600.00) - Luxury recovery, attractive entry point into Q3? LVMH: 买入（目标价：600.00欧元）——奢侈品复苏，进入第三季度的吸引|人切入点？
LVMH: Buy (PT: €600.00) - Luxury recovery, attractive entry point into Q3?
LVMH: 买入（目标价：600.00欧元）——奢侈品复苏，进入第三季度的吸引力买入时机？
All references to "we/us/our" refer to the views and observations of the desk. Sales view.
所有提及“我们/我方/我们的”均指本部门的观点和观察。销售观点。
LVMH: We see the frequent data points and the sequential acceleration reported by the peer group as attractive entry point with easier comps in H2. Specifically:
LVMH: 我们认为同行频繁发布的数据点以及顺序加速的表现，在下半年基数较低的情况下，构成了一个有吸引力的入场时机。具体如下：
1. Positive X-read from Swatch: unchanged trends in the US (+DD% growth) despite tariffs and price increases with positive tone for H2.
来自Swatch的积极参考：尽管有关税和提价，美国市场趋势保持不变（增长为两位数百分比），并且对下半年的前景持积极态度。
2. GS Luxury tracker: Europe to China leather handbags imports increased +7% in July, the first positive month since January 2024.
GS Luxury 追踪数据显示：2024年7月，欧洲对中国的皮革手袋进口增长了7%，这是自2024年1月以来的首个月度正增长。

3. Positive events for traffic creation: 1) Earlier than expected launch of La Beauté Louis Vuitton, 2) Jonathan Andersons first mens fashion show with over 1bn views, 3) the first womens ready to wear collection is scheduled for October 1st.
有利于引流的积极事件：1）La Beauté Louis Vuitton 提前于预期推出，2）Jonathan Anderson 的首场男装秀观看量超过10亿次，3）首个女装成衣系列定于10月1日发布。
4. Low Q3 comps: with the US Q3 0% (Q2 was +2%), Japan +20% (Q2 +57%), Asia -16% (Q2 -14%) & Europe +2% (Q2 +4%).
5. Japan tourism data: According to Japan National Tourism Organization (JNTO), the estimated number of international travelers to Japan in June 2025 was 3,377,800 (+7.6% compared to 2024). (Link)
日本旅游数据：根据日本国家旅游局（JNTO）数据，2025年6月赴日国际游客预估人数为3,377,800人，同比2024年增长 \(7.6\%\) 。（链接）

6. X-read Chinese consumer: August's casino gross gaming revenue (GGR) in Macau rose by \(+12.2\%\) YoY, standing at nearly MOP22.16 billion (US \(2.76 billion), showed data released on Monday by the city's Gaming Inspection and Coordination Bureau. Casino GGR in August marked the best monthly performance since January 2020, just before the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic. (Link)
中国消费者交叉参考：澳门8月份赌场总博彩收入（GGR）同比增长 \(12.2\%\) ，达到近221.6亿澳门元（27.6亿美元），据该市博彩监察协调局周一公布的数据。8月份的赌场总博彩收入创下自2020年1月（新冠疫情爆发前）以来的最佳单月表现。（链接）
LVMH Moet- Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH.PA): Post 2Q25: Challenges remain but encouraging signs; PT unchanged at €600; Remain Buy (on CL)
路威酪轩酪悦·轩尼诗－路易·威登集团（LVMH.PA）：2025年第二季度后：挑战依旧，但有令人鼓舞的迹象；目标价维持在600欧元；继续“买入”（列入核心推荐名单）
Europe Branded Consumer Goods: Luxury Goods Macro Tracker: China July data shows some encouraging signs, but trends remain choppy
欧洲品牌消费品：奢侈品宏观追踪：中国7月数据呈现一些积极信号，但趋势依然波动
Please let me know if you want to speak to Louise Singlehurst and Adrien Duverger...
如需与Louise Singlehurst和AdrienDuverger交流，请告知我...

- Positive X-read Swatch: Management reiterated comments made at 1H25 conference call describing double-digit growth performance in the US for every month to date (with July at +19% and August to date \(c. + 20\%\) underlying). Swatch Group confirmed that there has been no negative impact on demand in the US following an initial price increase post tariff announcements in April, which were between 5-8% across the portfolio of brands with an overall group average of \(c.5\%\) ). Management remains confident on the performance and continues to expect the US to perform well in 2H25. Management also highlighted that sell-out had been stronger than sell-in year-to-date.

积极的Swatch交叉验证：管理层重申了在2025年上半年电话会议上的评论，称截至目前美国市场每个月都实现了两位数的增长（7月为 \(+19\%\) ，截至8月约 \(+20\%\) 的基础增长）。Swatch集团确认，自4月关税公告后首次提价（各品牌组合提价幅度在5- 8%之间，集团整体平均约 \(5\%\) ）以来，美国市场的需求并未受到负面影响。管理层对业绩依然充满信心，并继续预期美国市场在2025年下半年表现良好。管理层还强调，截至目前售出量强于售入量。
- Frequent data: 1) US credit card data looks sequentially better for categories such as Luxury and Restaurants; 2) US retailers are guiding up and saying current trading is good
(see WSM/KSS and the whole list from the previous weeks here).

- LVMH is very good at converting traffic into sales: the first women's ready-to-wear collection is scheduled for October 1st and while management expects it will take time for new product to have an impact, this coupled with the success of recent handbag launches (eg the Toujours) can provide the opportunity for F&L to reduce the sales growth gap with peers.
- Launch of LV beauty: Earlier than expected launch of La Beaute Louis Vuitton resulting in earlier and full traffic effect for Q4.

- Positive headlines on new store in Shanghai: Louis Vuitton opened a new store in Shanghai in the shape of a yacht. The store is a pure tourist attraction and received a lot attention from international but also locals.
Q2 Earnings: LVMH delivered a \(- 3\%\) cFX sales decline in Q225, vs \(- 4\%\) VA Cons/- 6% GSE; Group EBIT broadly in line with expectations \((+2\%\) ahead VA cons).
- Per sector: LVMH reported a sequential acceleration in Wine & Spirits, Perfumes & Cosmetics, Selective Retailing and flattish trends in Watches & Jewelry.

- Fashion & Leather goods: sales fell \(-9\%\) cFX (VA Consensus \(-7\%\) / GSe \(-8\%\) ) which compares to \(-5\%\) in the prior period (1Q25); the sequential deterioration QoQ was due to weakness in tourism (also seen by peers including Moncler), particularly given the strong base of comparison in Japan - if we look at growth excl Japan, we estimate F&L declined \(-5\%\) in Q2 (in line with Q1). Good resilience among local customers but tourist spending affected by currency fluctuations.
- Perfumes & Cosmetics: \(+1\%\) organic; business group remained stable in the first half of 2025, maintaining its robust innovation policy and highly selective retail approach.

- Selective Retailing: \(+4\%\) organic; Sephora with further growth against a high basis of comparison; steady growth in Europe, the Middle East and Latin America; DFS demand still weak in Hong Kong, Macau and good performance in Japan.
- Watches & Jewelry: \(+0\%\) organic; business group remained stable in the first half of 2025; solid local demand in Europe and the United States with a ramp up in operational efficiency.

- Wine & Spirits: sales were above expectations at \(-4\%\) (VA cons \(-8\%\) / GSe \(-7\%\) ), benefiting from improving trends in Europe and US; improved trends for champagne and wines with weak demand for cognac.
Quarterly organic revenue change by business group (as %) vs. same period in 2024
Q2 2025Q2 2025FY 2025Wines &amp; Spirits-9%-4%-7%Fashion &amp; Leather Goods-5%-9%-7%Perfumes &amp; Cosmetics-1%+1%0%Watches &amp; Jewelry0%0%0%Selective Retailing-1%+4%+2%Total LVMH-3%-4%-3%
Source: LVMH, Financial report

- LVMH - Sequential improvement in China: "More specifically, we saw solid local demand in Europe and in the U.S., and a tangible sequential improvement when it comes to Mainland China in the second quarter. In addition, we saw very abrupt currency swing in Q2, which eroded the purchases of American and Chinese consumers abroad, and especially in Japan, where we faced a very abnormal growth of 57% in the same period last year."

- Brunello - significant +DD% growth in China: "As far as Asia is concerned, the situation has been excellent in China as well. China has been very positive across all its regions, Mainland, Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan. As for Japan, Japan is going back to its essence, to its nature, so primarily -- it's a primarily domestic market and it's a very positive for us compared to last year. As you may remember, this -- well, last year was a very special year. And so again, we expect a very beautiful, a very successful third quarter."

- Moncler - Small recovery in Chinese brand: "Regarding the Asian, let's say, performance, the performance in -- of the Chinese was positive in China with a cluster that was flattish. So much less consumption of Chinese in Europe, especially and in Japan. Korean were below the average performance of the nationalities and the locals in Europe were flattish. So what has been the main driver of the DTC performance during the quarter is the lack or the decrease in tourism, mainly from Korean and Chinese. And to a lesser extent, Americans also a little bit less present in Europe. Regarding the performance in Asia, the performance of Korea was helped by return of some tourism from China. You know that it decreased a lot in the past year. So we have seen a small recovery of Chinese brand. So they were positive on the Korean market while they were negative in Japan, mainly due to currency evolution that was in a way, we've seen the yen going up, the renminbi going down. So the price gap that was existing till the end of 2024 was not relevant enough to push Chinese to come and buy luxury goods, at least not Moncler, during the quarter."

- Kering - Chinese cluster broadly inline with Q1 and Asia Pacific 6ppt sequential improvement: "In Western Europe, Q2 decelerated sequentially, down 17% comparable. Local demand was still subdued, and tourism spending worsened, though not consistently across brands. North America was down 10% comparable, 3 percentage points better than Q1. Polarization based on positioning persisted, and Bottega Veneta continued to outperform. Gucci improved by 6 percentage points sequentially, an encouraging trend. In Q2, Gucci also did better with the American cluster, which was a touch softer for most of our other brands. Japan, down 29% comparable in Q2 was the region most impacted by weaker tourism spending due to less attractive exchange rate and price gap, compounding ICOMs, Asia Pacific declined 19% comparable in Q2, but posted a 6 point sequential improvement. Better trends in the region were driven by repatriation of spending, with Mainland China, Hong Kong, Macau, but also Singapore improving sequentially although still down double digits. The Chinese cluster was broadly in line with Q1, down high 20s. In the quarter, about one-fourth of spending by Chinese customers took place outside of their home market, and close to 80% of their overseas spending remained in Asia, including Japan. Finally, rest of the world turned negative, down 5% comparable in Q2 as events impacted the Middle East."
- Richemont - "Sequential improvement in China, Hong Kong and Macau combined, albeit still negative -7% with soft Mainland"
Low comps in Q3: with the US Q3 0% (Q2 was +2%), Japan +20% (Q2 +57%), Asia -16% (Q2 -14%) & Europe +2% (Q2 +4%).
Source:LVMH,Financialreport

Consensus development: Revenue and margins estimates came down significantly - we are in line with cons on organic sales (- 2% Full group) - fashion leather (- 4% cons - 5%), Ebit margin slightly below \(20.5\%\) cons VA at \(21.2\%\) .
GroupcFX-VAConsensus
\\*CFR/BRBY2H25,1H26,FY27
VA Consensus cFX Revenue growth revisions vs.Jan 15th 2025
\\*2H25,1H26,FY26,FY27forMar y/e

Current trends: China indicators (retail sales / luxury imports / assets) show positive signs into July, as handbags imports (highest correlation datapoints) return to growth for the first time since January 2024.

GREATER CHINA - Micro Tracker3Q234Q231Q242Q243Q244Q241Q252Q253Q25E2Q TrendRSOIn Modelvs. Chinavs. AFACLast DatapointRetail SalesChina Retail Sales - Restaurants / Catering11%27%9%2%0%1%5%3%0%↓0.72↓0.03Jul-25China Retail Sales - Clothing13%14%2%1%0%0%0%3%3%2%→0.490.08Jul-25China Retail Sales - Cosmetics2%2%3%0%-0%5%3%3%5%→0.810.40Jul-25China Retail Sales - Jewellery2%17%4%-5%-10%-2%7%18%8%↑X0.820.61Jul-25China Retail Sales - Department Stores1%22%-3%-3%-3%-3%1%1%1%↑→0.560.45Jul-25China Consumer Confidence - YoY-1%1%-5%0%-1%-1%-1%1%→0.130.05Jun-25Hong Kong - Retail Sales14%10%-1%-12%-10%-7%4%0%→0.120.44Jun-25Hong Kong - Department Store17%7%-7%-21%-17%-10%-6%5%→0.120.25Jun-25Hong Kong - Jewellery, Watch Sales34%44%0%-24%-23%-10%-12%1%→X0.110.41Jun-25Hong Kong - Clothing, Footwear, other products36%29%-1%-18%-13%-9%-8%-3%→0.130.46Jun-25Macau GGR780%421%55%24%13%0%1%8%19%→0.030.14Jul-25Exports / ImportsSwiss Watch Exports - China + HK-4%12%-22%-18%-26%-22%-17%-15%-1%↑X0.460.72Jul-25Italy Leather Accessory Exports to China8%29%2%-9%-19%-25%-29%-23%→0.460.81Jun-25China Leather Handbags Imports (from FR, IT, CH)-2%11%-15%-22%-20%-15%-22%-7%7%→X0.560.60Jul-25China Handbags Imports (from FR, IT, CH)2%12%-9%-16%-19%-13%-20%-10%2%→0.550.60Jul-25China Jewellery Imports (from FR, IT, CH)26%32%-17%-17%-45%-13%-29%-3%6%→0.480.18Jul-25
Source: Company data, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research, China Customs, FHS, Global Blue, DICJ, Thomson Reuters Eikon, Censtatd, Istat, National Bureau of Statistics of China
Valuation: P/E at 20.7x in line with historical average.
Source:GoldmanSachsGlobalInvestmentResearch,Reuters/Datastream
We are here to help - - please feel free to reach out to me with anything that doesn't add up or where you have a different view. Happy to discuss my thoughts and/or arrange a call with our analyst.
Kind regards, Kai Schopa
